revised_title: On the Steady Motion and Small Vibrations of a Hollow Vortex
tldr: The author investigates the steady motion and small vibrations of a hollow vortex, introducing new functions to represent stream lines and analyze the motion. They explore the relationship between the vortex's size, translatory velocity, and energy, and consider the differences between solid and hollow vortex rings. The study also examines the time of vibration for crimped cross sections and pulsating hollows, with the hope of further investigating these cases in the future.
